page.title: 15Local History,Scremerston.
page.content: The earliest documentary reference to Scremerston is about{1130}when the spelling is shown as{Scrimestan.} In{1249 }the lord of the manor of Scremerston,{Sir William de {Scremerston}was a{Border Commissioner. The village was completely destroyed by the Scots in{1386}but was later rebuilt.The tower or fortalice of Scremerston is mentioned in{1416 but by {1542} was described as{"a {greate-old toure much decayed". When the plague visited Scremerston in {1667 }the sick were taken down to the links on the seashore where huts were erected from the bent growing there. Coal seems to have been worked in Scremerston from an early period but all the mines closed about 45 years ago.
